metadata.name: Location Type
metadata.description:
US NGA Feature Designation Codes

On this codelist 'category' is used for the Feature Class.

STMQ.name: abandoned watercourse
STMQ.description: a former stream or distributary no longer carrying flowing water, but still evident due to lakes, wetland, topographic or vegetation patterns

ADMD.name: administrative division
ADMD.description: an administrative division of a political entity, undifferentiated as to administrative level

AGRC.name: agricultural colony
AGRC.description: a tract of land set aside for agricultural settlement

AGRF.name: agricultural facility
AGRF.description: a building and/or tract of land used for improving agriculture

RESA.name: agricultural reserve
RESA.description: a tract of land reserved for agricultural reclamation and/or development

SCHA.name: agricultural school
SCHA.description: a school with a curriculum focused on agriculture

AIRB.name: airbase
AIRB.description: an area used to store supplies, provide barracks for air force personnel, hangars and runways for aircraft, and from which operations are initiated

AIRF.name: airfield
AIRF.description: a place on land where aircraft land and take off; no facilities provided for the commercial handling of passengers and cargo

AIRP.name: airport
AIRP.description: a place where aircraft regularly land and take off, with runways, navigational aids, and major facilities for the commercial handling of passengers and cargo

AMTH.name: amphitheater
AMTH.description: an oval or circular structure with rising tiers of seats about a stage or open space

STMA.name: anabranch
STMA.description: a diverging branch flowing out of a main stream and rejoining it downstream

ANCH.name: anchorage
ANCH.description: an area where vessels may anchor

RDA.name: ancient road
RDA.description: the remains of a road used by ancient cultures

ANS.name: ancient site
ANS.description: a place where archeological remains, old structures, or cultural artifacts are located

WALLA.name: ancient wall
WALLA.description: the remains of a linear defensive stone structure

BLDA.name: apartment building
BLDA.description: a building containing several individual apartments

AQC.name: aquaculture facility
AQC.description: facility or area for the cultivation of aquatic animals and plants, especially fish, shellfish, and seaweed, in natural or controlled marine or freshwater environments; underwater agriculture

CNLA.name: aqueduct
CNLA.description: a conduit used to carry water

ARCH.name: arch
ARCH.description: a natural or man-made structure in the form of an arch

LAND.name: Arctic land
LAND.description: a tract of land in the Arctic

AREA.name: area
AREA.description: a tract of land without homogeneous character or boundaries

ISLF.name: artificial island
ISLF.description: an island created by landfill or diking and filling in a wetland, bay, or lagoon

RNGA.name: artillery range
RNGA.description: a tract of land used for artillery firing practice

ASPH.name: asphalt lake
ASPH.description: a small basin containing naturally occurring asphalt

ASTR.name: astronomical station
ASTR.description: a point on the earth whose position has been determined by observations of celestial bodies

ASYL.name: asylum
ASYL.description: a facility where the insane are cared for and protected

ATHF.name: athletic field
ATHF.description: a tract of land used for playing team sports, and athletic track and field events

ATOL.name: atoll(s)
ATOL.description: a ring-shaped coral reef which has closely spaced islands on it encircling a lagoon

CTRA.name: atomic center
CTRA.description: a facility where atomic research is carried out

BDLD.name: badlands
BDLD.description: an area characterized by a maze of very closely spaced, deep, narrow, steep-sided ravines, and sharp crests and pinnacles

BSTN.name: baling station
BSTN.description: a facility for baling agricultural products

ESTB.name: banana plantation
ESTB.description: an estate that specializes in the growing of bananas

BAN.name: bank
BAN.description: an establishment for the custody, loan, exchange or issue of money, for the extension of credit, and for facilitating the transmission of funds

BNK.name: bank(s)
BNK.description: an elevation, typically located on a shelf, over which the depth of water is relatively shallow but sufficient for most surface navigation

BAR.name: bar
BAR.description: a shallow ridge or mound of coarse unconsolidated material in a stream channel, at the mouth of a stream, estuary, or lagoon and in the wave-break zone along coasts

BRKS.name: barracks
BRKS.description: a building for lodging military personnel

BTL.name: battlefield
BTL.description: a site of a land battle of historical importance

BAY.name: bay
BAY.description: a coastal indentation between two capes or headlands, larger than a cove but smaller than a gulf

BAYS.name: bays
BAYS.description: coastal indentations between two capes or headlands, larger than a cove but smaller than a gulf

BCH.name: beach
BCH.description: a shore zone of coarse unconsolidated sediment that extends from the low-water line to the highest reach of storm waves

RDGB.name: beach ridge
RDGB.description: a ridge of sand just inland and parallel to the beach, usually in series

BCHS.name: beaches
BCHS.description: a shore zone of coarse unconsolidated sediment that extends from the low-water line to the highest reach of storm waves

BNCH.name: bench
BNCH.description: a long, narrow bedrock platform bounded by steeper slopes above and below, usually overlooking a waterbody

BGHT.name: bight(s)
BGHT.description: an open body of water forming a slight recession in a coastline

BLHL.name: blowhole(s)
BLHL.description: a hole in coastal rock through which sea water is forced by a rising tide or waves and spurted through an outlet into the air

BLOW.name: blowout(s)
BLOW.description: a small depression in sandy terrain, caused by wind erosion

BTYD.name: boatyard
BTYD.description: a waterside facility for servicing, repairing, and building small vessels

BOG.name: bog(s)
BOG.description: a wetland characterized by peat forming sphagnum moss, sedge, and other acid-water plants

PSTB.name: border post
PSTB.description: a post or station at an international boundary for the regulation of movement of people and goods

BLDR.name: boulder field
BLDR.description: a high altitude or high latitude bare, flat area covered with large angular rocks

BP.name: boundary marker
BP.description: a fixture marking a point along a boundary

BRKW.name: breakwater
BRKW.description: a structure erected to break the force of waves at the entrance to a harbor or port

MFGB.name: brewery
MFGB.description: one or more buildings where beer is brewed

BDG.name: bridge
BDG.description: a structure erected across an obstacle such as a stream, road, etc., in order to carry roads, railroads, and pedestrians across

ZNB.name: buffer zone
ZNB.description: a zone recognized as a buffer between two nations in which military presence is minimal or absent

BLDG.name: building(s)
BLDG.description: a structure built for permanent use, as a house, factory, etc.

BUR.name: burial cave(s)
BUR.description: a cave used for human burials

BUSH.name: bush(es)
BUSH.description: a small clump of conspicuous bushes in an otherwise bare area

CTRB.name: business center
CTRB.description: a place where a number of businesses are located

BUTE.name: butte(s)
BUTE.description: a small, isolated, usually flat-topped hill with steep sides

CARN.name: cairn
CARN.description: a heap of stones erected as a landmark or for other purposes

CLDA.name: caldera
CLDA.description: a depression measuring kilometers across formed by the collapse of a volcanic mountain

CMP.name: camp(s)
CMP.description: a site occupied by tents, huts, or other shelters for temporary use

CNLB.name: canal bend
CNLB.description: a conspicuously curved or bent section of a canal

TNLC.name: canal tunnel
TNLC.description: a tunnel through which a canal passes

STMC.name: canalized stream
STMC.description: a stream that has been substantially ditched, diked, or straightened

MFGC.name: cannery
MFGC.description: a building where food items are canned

CNYN.name: canyon
CNYN.description: a deep, narrow valley with steep sides cutting into a plateau or mountainous area

CAPE.name: cape
CAPE.description: a land area, more prominent than a point, projecting into the sea and marking a notable change in coastal direction

CSNO.name: casino
CSNO.description: a building used for entertainment, especially gambling

CSTL.name: castle
CSTL.description: a large fortified building or set of buildings

TNKD.name: cattle dipping tank
TNKD.description: a small artificial pond used for immersing cattle in chemically treated water for disease control

CSWY.name: causeway
CSWY.description: a raised roadway across wet ground or shallow water

CAVE.name: cave(s)
CAVE.description: an underground passageway or chamber, or cavity on the side of a cliff

CHN.name: channel
CHN.description: the deepest part of a stream, bay, lagoon, or strait, through which the main current flows

MNCR.name: chrome mine(s)
MNCR.description: a mine where chrome ore is extracted

CH.name: church
CH.description: a building for public Christian worship

CRQ.name: cirque
CRQ.description: a bowl-like hollow partially surrounded by cliffs or steep slopes at the head of a glaciated valley

CRQS.name: cirques
CRQS.description: bowl-like hollows partially surrounded by cliffs or steep slopes at the head of a glaciated valley

CLG.name: clearing
CLG.description: an area in a forest with trees removed

CFT.name: cleft(s)
CFT.description: a deep narrow slot, notch, or groove in a coastal cliff

CLF.name: cliff(s)
CLF.description: a high, steep to perpendicular slope overlooking a waterbody or lower area

HSPC.name: clinic
HSPC.description: a medical facility associated with a hospital for outpatients

MNC.name: coal mine(s)
MNC.description: a mine where coal is extracted

COLF.name: coalfield
COLF.description: a region in which coal deposits of possible economic value occur

CST.name: coast
CST.description: a zone of variable width straddling the shoreline

STNC.name: coast guard station
STNC.description: a facility from which the coast is guarded by armed vessels

SCHC.name: college
SCHC.description: the grounds and buildings of an institution of higher learning

CMN.name: common
CMN.description: a park or pasture for community use

COMC.name: communication center
COMC.description: a facility, including buildings, antennae, towers and electronic equipment for receiving and transmitting information

CTRCM.name: community center
CTRCM.description: a facility for community recreation and other activities

CNS.name: concession area
CNS.description: a lease of land by a government for economic development, e.g., mining, forestry

CONE.name: cone(s)
CONE.description: a conical landform composed of mud or volcanic material

CNFL.name: confluence
CNFL.description: a place where two or more streams or intermittent streams flow together

CRSU.name: continental rise
CRSU.description: a gentle slope rising from oceanic depths towards the foot of a continental slope

CVNT.name: convent
CVNT.description: a building where a community of nuns lives in seclusion

MNCU.name: copper mine(s)
MNCU.description: a mine where copper ore is extracted

MFGCU.name: copper works
MFGCU.description: a facility for processing copper ore

RFC.name: coral reef(s)
RFC.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of coral

CRRL.name: corral(s)
CRRL.description: a pen or enclosure for confining or capturing animals

CRDR.name: corridor
CRDR.description: a strip or area of land having significance as an access way

ESTC.name: cotton plantation
ESTC.description: an estate specializing in the cultivation of cotton

HSEC.name: country house
HSEC.description: a large house, mansion, or chateau, on a large estate

CTHSE.name: courthouse
CTHSE.description: a building in which courts of law are held

COVE.name: cove(s)
COVE.description: a small coastal indentation, smaller than a bay

LKC.name: crater lake
LKC.description: a lake in a crater or caldera

LKSC.name: crater lakes
LKSC.description: lakes in a crater or caldera

CRTR.name: crater(s)
CRTR.description: a generally circular saucer or bowl-shaped depression caused by volcanic or meteorite explosive action

CUET.name: cuesta(s)
CUET.description: an asymmetric ridge formed on tilted strata

CRNT.name: current
CRNT.description: a horizontal flow of water in a given direction with uniform velocity

CSTM.name: customs house
CSTM.description: a building in a port where customs and duties are paid, and where vessels are entered and cleared

PSTC.name: customs post
PSTC.description: a building at an international boundary where customs and duties are paid on goods

CUTF.name: cutoff
CUTF.description: a channel formed as a result of a stream cutting through a meander neck

DARY.name: dairy
DARY.description: a facility for the processing, sale and distribution of milk or milk products

DAM.name: dam
DAM.description: a barrier constructed across a stream to impound water

DEPU.name: deep
DEPU.description: a localized deep area within the confines of a larger feature, such as a trough, basin or trench

DLTA.name: delta
DLTA.description: a flat plain formed by alluvial deposits at the mouth of a stream

DPR.name: depression(s)
DPR.description: a low area surrounded by higher land and usually characterized by interior drainage

DSRT.name: desert
DSRT.description: a large area with little or no vegetation due to extreme environmental conditions

PPLW.name: destroyed populated place
PPLW.description: a village, town or city destroyed by a natural disaster, or by war

MNDT.name: diatomite mine(s)
MNDT.description: a place where diatomaceous earth is extracted

DIKE.name: dike
DIKE.description: an earth or stone embankment usually constructed for flood or stream control

DIP.name: diplomatic facility
DIP.description: office, residence, or facility of a foreign government, which may include an embassy, consulate, chancery, office of charge d’affaires, or other diplomatic, economic, military, or cultural mission

HSPD.name: dispensary
HSPD.description: a building where medical or dental aid is dispensed

STMD.name: distributary(-ies)
STMD.description: a branch which flows away from the main stream, as in a delta or irrigation canal

DTCH.name: ditch
DTCH.description: a small artificial watercourse dug for draining or irrigating the land

DTCHM.name: ditch mouth(s)
DTCHM.description: an area where a drainage ditch enters a lagoon, lake or bay

DVD.name: divide
DVD.description: a line separating adjacent drainage basins

DCK.name: dock(s)
DCK.description: a waterway between two piers, or cut into the land for the berthing of ships

DCKB.name: docking basin
DCKB.description: a part of a harbor where ships dock

DCKY.name: dockyard
DCKY.description: a facility for servicing, building, or repairing ships

BSND.name: drainage basin
BSND.description: an area drained by a stream

CNLD.name: drainage canal
CNLD.description: an artificial waterway carrying water away from a wetland or from drainage ditches

DTCHD.name: drainage ditch
DTCHD.description: a ditch which serves to drain the land

DCKD.name: dry dock
DCKD.description: a dock providing support for a vessel, and means for removing the water so that the bottom of the vessel can be exposed

SBED.name: dry stream bed
SBED.description: a channel formerly containing the water of a stream

DUNE.name: dune(s)
DUNE.description: a wave form, ridge or star shape feature composed of sand

RGNE.name: economic region
RGNE.description: a region of a country established for economic development or for statistical purposes

SCRP.name: escarpment
SCRP.description: a long line of cliffs or steep slopes separating level surfaces above and below

EST.name: estate(s)
EST.description: a large commercialized agricultural landholding with associated buildings and other facilities

ESTY.name: estuary
ESTY.description: a funnel-shaped stream mouth or embayment where fresh water mixes with sea water under tidal influences

STNE.name: experiment station
STNE.description: a facility for carrying out experiments

FCL.name: facility
FCL.description: a building or buildings housing a center, institute, foundation, hospital, prison, mission, courthouse, etc.

CTRF.name: facility center
CTRF.description: a place where more than one facility is situated

MFG.name: factory
MFG.description: one or more buildings where goods are manufactured, processed or fabricated

FAN.name: fan(s)
FAN.description: a fan-shaped wedge of coarse alluvium with apex merging with a mountain stream bed and the fan spreading out at a low angle slope onto an adjacent plain

FRM.name: farm
FRM.description: a tract of land with associated buildings devoted to agriculture

PPLF.name: farm village
PPLF.description: a populated place where the population is largely engaged in agricultural activities

FRMS.name: farms
FRMS.description: tracts of land with associated buildings devoted to agriculture

FRMT.name: farmstead
FRMT.description: the buildings and adjacent service areas of a farm

FY.name: ferry
FY.description: a boat or other floating conveyance and terminal facilities regularly used to transport people and vehicles across a waterbody

FYT.name: ferry terminal
FYT.description: a place where ferries pick-up and discharge passengers, vehicles and or cargo

FLD.name: field(s)
FLD.description: an open as opposed to wooded area

FIRE.name: fire station
FIRE.description: building housing firefighters and/or fire fighting equipment

ADM1.name: first-order administrative division
ADM1.description: a primary administrative division of a country, such as a state in the United States

FISH.name: fishing area
FISH.description: a fishing ground, bank or area where fishermen go to catch fish

PNDSF.name: fishponds
PNDSF.description: ponds or enclosures in which fish are kept or raised

FJD.name: fjord
FJD.description: a long, narrow, steep-walled, deep-water arm of the sea at high latitudes, usually along mountainous coasts

FJDS.name: fjords
FJDS.description: long, narrow, steep-walled, deep-water arms of the sea at high latitudes, usually along mountainous coasts

FORD.name: ford
FORD.description: a shallow part of a stream which can be crossed on foot or by land vehicle

RESF.name: forest reserve
RESF.description: a forested area set aside for preservation or controlled use

STNF.name: forest station
STNF.description: a collection of buildings and facilities for carrying out forest management

FRST.name: forest(s)
FRST.description: an area dominated by tree vegetation

INLTQ.name: former inlet
INLTQ.description: an inlet which has been filled in, or blocked by deposits

MLSGQ.name: former sugar mill
MLSGQ.description: a sugar mill no longer used as a sugar mill

FRSTF.name: fossilized forest
FRSTF.description: a forest fossilized by geologic processes and now exposed at the earth's surface

FNDY.name: foundry
FNDY.description: a building or works where metal casting is carried out

ADM4.name: fourth-order administrative division
ADM4.description: a subdivision of a third-order administrative division

ZNF.name: free trade zone
ZNF.description: an area, usually a section of a port, where goods may be received and shipped free of customs duty and of most customs regulations

DPOF.name: fuel depot
DPOF.description: an area where fuel is stored

GAP.name: gap
GAP.description: a low place in a ridge, not used for transportation

GDN.name: garden(s)
GDN.description: an enclosure for displaying selected plant or animal life

GOSP.name: gas-oil separator plant
GOSP.description: a facility for separating gas from oil

GASF.name: gasfield
GASF.description: an area containing a subterranean store of natural gas of economic value

GATE.name: gate
GATE.description: a controlled access entrance or exit

GYSR.name: geyser
GYSR.description: a type of hot spring with intermittent eruptions of jets of hot water and steam

GHAT.name: ghāt
GHAT.description: a set of steps leading to a river, which are of religious significance, and at their base is usually a platform for bathing

GLCR.name: glacier(s)
GLCR.description: a mass of ice, usually at high latitudes or high elevations, with sufficient thickness to flow away from the source area in lobes, tongues, or masses

MNAU.name: gold mine(s)
MNAU.description: a mine where gold ore, or alluvial gold is extracted

RECG.name: golf course
RECG.description: a recreation field where golf is played

GRGE.name: gorge(s)
GRGE.description: a short, narrow, steep-sided section of a stream valley

GRSLD.name: grassland
GRSLD.description: an area dominated by grass vegetation

GRAZ.name: grazing area
GRAZ.description: an area of grasses and shrubs used for grazing

GHSE.name: guest house
GHSE.description: a house used to provide lodging for paying guests

GULF.name: gulf
GULF.description: a large recess in the coastline, larger than a bay

HLT.name: halting place
HLT.description: a place where caravans stop for rest

HMCK.name: hammock(s)
HMCK.description: a patch of ground, distinct from and slightly above the surrounding plain or wetland. Often occurs in groups

AIRG.name: hangar
AIRG.description: a covered and usually enclosed area for housing and repairing aircraft

VALG.name: hanging valley
VALG.description: a valley the floor of which is notably higher than the valley or shore to which it leads; most common in areas that have been glaciated

HBR.name: harbor(s)
HBR.description: a haven or space of deep water so sheltered by the adjacent land as to afford a safe anchorage for ships

HDLD.name: headland
HDLD.description: a high projection of land extending into a large body of water beyond the line of the coast

STMH.name: headwaters
STMH.description: the source and upper part of a stream, including the upper drainage basin

HTH.name: heath
HTH.description: an upland moor or sandy area dominated by low shrubby vegetation including heather

AIRH.name: heliport
AIRH.description: a place where helicopters land and take off

HERM.name: hermitage
HERM.description: a secluded residence, usually for religious sects

HLL.name: hill
HLL.description: a rounded elevation of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m

HLLS.name: hills
HLLS.description: rounded elevations of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m

ADMDH.name: historical administrative division
ADMDH.description: a former administrative division of a political entity, undifferentiated as to administrative level

PPLH.name: historical populated place
PPLH.description: a populated place that no longer exists

RRH.name: historical railroad
RRH.description: a former permanent twin steel-rail track on which freight and passenger cars move long distances

RSTNH.name: historical railroad station
RSTNH.description: a former facility comprising ticket office, platforms, etc. for loading and unloading train passengers and freight

RGNH.name: historical region
RGNH.description: a former area distinguished by one or more observable physical or cultural characteristics

UFHU.name: historical undersea feature
UFHU.description: an undersea feature whose existence has been subsequently disproved

HMSD.name: homestead
HMSD.description: a residence, owner's or manager's, on a sheep or cattle station, woolshed, outcamp, or Aboriginal outstation, specific to Australia and New Zealand

HSP.name: hospital
HSP.description: a building in which sick or injured, especially those confined to bed, are medically treated

SPNT.name: hot spring(s)
SPNT.description: a place where hot ground water flows naturally out of the ground

HTL.name: hotel
HTL.description: a building providing lodging and/or meals for the public

HSE.name: house(s)
HSE.description: a building used as a human habitation

DEVH.name: housing development
DEVH.description: a tract of land on which many houses of similar design are built according to a development plan

RESH.name: hunting reserve
RESH.description: a tract of land used primarily for hunting

PSH.name: hydroelectric power station
PSH.description: a building where electricity is generated from water power

CAPG.name: icecap
CAPG.description: a dome-shaped mass of glacial ice covering an area of mountain summits or other high lands; smaller than an ice sheet

DPRG.name: icecap depression
DPRG.description: a comparatively depressed area on an icecap

DOMG.name: icecap dome
DOMG.description: a comparatively elevated area on an icecap

RDGG.name: icecap ridge
RDGG.description: a linear elevation on an icecap

INDS.name: industrial area
INDS.description: an area characterized by industrial activity

INLT.name: inlet
INLT.description: a narrow waterway extending into the land, or connecting a bay or lagoon with a larger body of water

STNI.name: inspection station
STNI.description: a station at which vehicles, goods, and people are inspected

TRGD.name: interdune trough(s)
TRGD.description: a long wind-swept trough between parallel longitudinal dunes

INTF.name: interfluve
INTF.description: a relatively undissected upland between adjacent stream valleys

RDIN.name: intersection
RDIN.description: a junction of two or more highways by a system of separate levels that permit traffic to pass from one to another without the crossing of traffic streams

MNFE.name: iron mine(s)
MNFE.description: a mine where iron ore is extracted

FLDI.name: irrigated field(s)
FLDI.description: a tract of level or terraced land which is irrigated

CNLI.name: irrigation canal
CNLI.description: a canal which serves as a main conduit for irrigation water

DTCHI.name: irrigation ditch
DTCHI.description: a ditch which serves to distribute irrigation water

SYSI.name: irrigation system
SYSI.description: a network of ditches and one or more of the following elements: water supply, reservoir, canal, pump, well, drain, etc.

ISL.name: island
ISL.description: a tract of land, smaller than a continent, surrounded by water at high water

ISLS.name: islands
ISLS.description: tracts of land, smaller than a continent, surrounded by water at high water

ISTH.name: isthmus
ISTH.description: a narrow strip of land connecting two larger land masses and bordered by water

JTY.name: jetty
JTY.description: a structure built out into the water at a river mouth or harbor entrance to regulate currents and silting

KRST.name: karst area
KRST.description: a distinctive landscape developed on soluble rock such as limestone characterized by sinkholes, caves, disappearing streams, and underground drainage

CMPLA.name: labor camp
CMPLA.description: a camp used by migrant or temporary laborers

LGN.name: lagoon
LGN.description: a shallow coastal waterbody, completely or partly separated from a larger body of water by a barrier island, coral reef or other depositional feature

LGNS.name: lagoons
LGNS.description: shallow coastal waterbodies, completely or partly separated from a larger body of water by a barrier island, coral reef or other depositional feature

LK.name: lake
LK.description: a large inland body of standing water

LBED.name: lake bed(s)
LBED.description: a dried up or drained area of a former lake

CHNL.name: lake channel(s)
CHNL.description: that part of a lake having water deep enough for navigation between islands, shoals, etc.

RGNL.name: lake region
RGNL.description: a tract of land distinguished by numerous lakes

LKS.name: lakes
LKS.description: large inland bodies of standing water

ISLT.name: land-tied island
ISLT.description: a coastal island connected to the mainland by barrier beaches, levees or dikes

LNDF.name: landfill
LNDF.description: a place for trash and garbage disposal in which the waste is buried between layers of earth to build up low-lying land

LDNG.name: landing
LDNG.description: a place where boats receive or discharge passengers and freight, but lacking most port facilities

MNPB.name: lead mine(s)
MNPB.description: a mine where lead ore is extracted

LTER.name: leased area
LTER.description: a tract of land leased by the United Kingdom from the People's Republic of China to form part of Hong Kong

LEPC.name: leper colony
LEPC.description: a settled area inhabited by lepers in relative isolation

HSPL.name: leprosarium
HSPL.description: an asylum or hospital for lepers

LEV.name: levee
LEV.description: a natural low embankment bordering a distributary or meandering stream; often built up artificially to control floods

LTHSE.name: lighthouse
LTHSE.description: a distinctive structure exhibiting a major navigation light

MFGLM.name: limekiln
MFGLM.description: a furnace in which limestone is reduced to lime

GOVL.name: local government office
GOVL.description: a facility housing local governmental offices, usually a city, town, or village hall

LCTY.name: locality
LCTY.description: a minor area or place of unspecified or mixed character and indefinite boundaries

LOCK.name: lock(s)
LOCK.description: a basin in a waterway with gates at each end by means of which vessels are passed from one water level to another

STMSB.name: lost river
STMSB.description: a surface stream that disappears into an underground channel, or dries up in an arid area

MVA.name: maneuver area
MVA.description: a tract of land where military field exercises are carried out

ISLM.name: mangrove island
ISLM.description: a mangrove swamp surrounded by a waterbody

MGV.name: mangrove swamp
MGV.description: a tropical tidal mud flat characterized by mangrove vegetation

MAR.name: marina
MAR.description: a harbor facility for small boats, yachts, etc.

CHNM.name: marine channel
CHNM.description: that part of a body of water deep enough for navigation through an area otherwise not suitable

SCHN.name: maritime school
SCHN.description: a school at which maritime sciences form the core of the curriculum

MKT.name: market
MKT.description: a place where goods are bought and sold at regular intervals

MRSH.name: marsh(es)
MRSH.description: a wetland dominated by grass-like vegetation

MDW.name: meadow
MDW.description: a small, poorly drained area dominated by grassy vegetation

NKM.name: meander neck
NKM.description: a narrow strip of land between the two limbs of a meander loop at its narrowest point

CTRM.name: medical center
CTRM.description: a complex of health care buildings including two or more of the following: hospital, medical school, clinic, pharmacy, doctor's offices, etc.

MESA.name: mesa(s)
MESA.description: a flat-topped, isolated elevation with steep slopes on all sides, less extensive than a plateau

STNM.name: meteorological station
STNM.description: a station at which weather elements are recorded

MILB.name: military base
MILB.description: a place used by an army or other armed service for storing arms and supplies, and for accommodating and training troops, a base from which operations can be initiated

INSM.name: military installation
INSM.description: a facility for use of and control by armed forces

SCHM.name: military school
SCHM.description: a school at which military science forms the core of the curriculum

ML.name: mill(s)
ML.description: a building housing machines for transforming, shaping, finishing, grinding, or extracting products

MN.name: mine(s)
MN.description: a site where mineral ores are extracted from the ground by excavating surface pits and subterranean passages

MNA.name: mining area
MNA.description: an area of mine sites where minerals and ores are extracted

MSSN.name: mission
MSSN.description: a place characterized by dwellings, school, church, hospital and other facilities operated by a religious group for the purpose of providing charitable services and to propagate religion

MOLE.name: mole
MOLE.description: a massive structure of masonry or large stones serving as a pier or breakwater

MSTY.name: monastery
MSTY.description: a building and grounds where a community of monks lives in seclusion

MOOR.name: moor(s)
MOOR.description: an area of open ground overlaid with wet peaty soils

MRN.name: moraine
MRN.description: a mound, ridge, or other accumulation of glacial till

MSQE.name: mosque
MSQE.description: a building for public Islamic worship

MT.name: mountain
MT.description: an elevation standing high above the surrounding area with small summit area, steep slopes and local relief of 300m or more

MTS.name: mountains
MTS.description: a mountain range or a group of mountains or high ridges

FLTM.name: mud flat(s)
FLTM.description: a relatively level area of mud either between high and low tide lines, or subject to flooding

MFGM.name: munitions plant
MFGM.description: a factory where ammunition is made

MUS.name: museum
MUS.description: a building where objects of permanent interest in one or more of the arts and sciences are preserved and exhibited

NRWS.name: narrows
NRWS.description: a navigable narrow part of a bay, strait, river, etc.

TNLN.name: natural tunnel
TNLN.description: a cave that is open at both ends

RESN.name: nature reserve
RESN.description: an area reserved for the maintenance of a natural habitat

NVB.name: naval base
NVB.description: an area used to store supplies, provide barracks for troops and naval personnel, a port for naval vessels, and from which operations are initiated

CNLN.name: navigation canal(s)
CNLN.description: a watercourse constructed for navigation of vessels

CHNN.name: navigation channel
CHNN.description: a buoyed channel of sufficient depth for the safe navigation of vessels

MNNI.name: nickel mine(s)
MNNI.description: a mine where nickel ore is extracted

NOV.name: novitiate
NOV.description: a religious house or school where novices are trained

NTK.name: nunatak
NTK.description: a rock or mountain peak protruding through glacial ice

NTKS.name: nunataks
NTKS.description: rocks or mountain peaks protruding through glacial ice

NSY.name: nursery(-ies)
NSY.description: a place where plants are propagated for transplanting or grafting

OAS.name: oasis(-es)
OAS.description: an area in a desert made productive by the availability of water

OBPT.name: observation point
OBPT.description: a wildlife or scenic observation point

OBS.name: observatory
OBS.description: a facility equipped for observation of atmospheric or space phenomena

OCN.name: ocean
OCN.description: one of the major divisions of the vast expanse of salt water covering part of the earth

BLDO.name: office building
BLDO.description: commercial building where business and/or services are conducted

CMPO.name: oil camp
CMPO.description: a camp used by oilfield workers

ESTO.name: oil palm plantation
ESTO.description: an estate specializing in the cultivation of oil palm trees

OILP.name: oil pipeline
OILP.description: a pipeline used for transporting oil

OILJ.name: oil pipeline junction
OILJ.description: a section of an oil pipeline where two or more pipes join together

TRMO.name: oil pipeline terminal
TRMO.description: a tank farm or loading facility at the end of an oil pipeline

PMPO.name: oil pumping station
PMPO.description: a facility for pumping oil through a pipeline

OILR.name: oil refinery
OILR.description: a facility for converting crude oil into refined petroleum products

OILW.name: oil well
OILW.description: a well from which oil may be pumped

OILF.name: oilfield
OILF.description: an area containing a subterranean store of petroleum of economic value

MLO.name: olive oil mill
MLO.description: a mill where oil is extracted from olives

OCH.name: orchard(s)
OCH.description: a planting of fruit or nut trees

MLM.name: ore treatment plant
MLM.description: a facility for improving the metal content of ore by concentration

OVF.name: overfalls
OVF.description: an area of breaking waves caused by the meeting of currents or by waves moving against the current

LKO.name: oxbow lake
LKO.description: a crescent-shaped lake commonly found adjacent to meandering streams

PGDA.name: pagoda
PGDA.description: a tower-like storied structure, usually a Buddhist shrine

PAL.name: palace
PAL.description: a large stately house, often a royal or presidential residence

RESP.name: palm tree reserve
RESP.description: an area of palm trees where use is controlled

PAN.name: pan
PAN.description: a near-level shallow, natural depression or basin, usually containing an intermittent lake, pond, or pool

PANS.name: pans
PANS.description: a near-level shallow, natural depression or basin, usually containing an intermittent lake, pond, or pool

PRK.name: park
PRK.description: an area, often of forested land, maintained as a place of beauty, or for recreation

PRKGT.name: park gate
PRKGT.description: a controlled access to a park

GARG.name: parking garage
GARG.description: a building or underground facility used exclusively for parking vehicles

PKLT.name: parking lot
PKLT.description: an area used for parking vehicles

PASS.name: pass
PASS.description: a break in a mountain range or other high obstruction, used for transportation from one side to the other [See also gap]

PSTP.name: patrol post
PSTP.description: a post from which patrols are sent out

PK.name: peak
PK.description: a pointed elevation atop a mountain, ridge, or other hypsographic feature

PKS.name: peaks
PKS.description: pointed elevations atop a mountain, ridge, or other hypsographic features

PEAT.name: peat cutting area
PEAT.description: an area where peat is harvested

PEN.name: peninsula
PEN.description: an elongate area of land projecting into a body of water and nearly surrounded by water

BSNP.name: petroleum basin
BSNP.description: an area underlain by an oil-rich structural basin

PIER.name: pier
PIER.description: a structure built out into navigable water on piles providing berthing for ships and recreation

MNPL.name: placer mine(s)
MNPL.description: a place where heavy metals are concentrated and running water is used to extract them from unconsolidated sediments

PLN.name: plain(s)
PLN.description: an extensive area of comparatively level to gently undulating land, lacking surface irregularities, and usually adjacent to a higher area

PLAT.name: plateau
PLAT.description: an elevated plain with steep slopes on one or more sides, and often with incised streams

PT.name: point
PT.description: a tapering piece of land projecting into a body of water, less prominent than a cape

PTS.name: points
PTS.description: tapering pieces of land projecting into a body of water, less prominent than a cape

PLDR.name: polder
PLDR.description: an area reclaimed from the sea by diking and draining

PP.name: police post
PP.description: a building in which police are stationed

POOL.name: pool(s)
POOL.description: a small and comparatively still, deep part of a larger body of water such as a stream or harbor; or a small body of standing water

PPLL.name: populated locality
PPLL.description: an area similar to a locality but with a small group of dwellings or other buildings

PPL.name: populated place
PPL.description: a city, town, village, or other agglomeration of buildings where people live and work

PPLS.name: populated places
PPLS.description: cities, towns, villages, or other agglomerations of buildings where people live and work

PRT.name: port
PRT.description: a place provided with terminal and transfer facilities for loading and discharging waterborne cargo or passengers, usually located in a harbor

PTGE.name: portage
PTGE.description: a place where boats, goods, etc., are carried overland between navigable waters

PO.name: post office
PO.description: a public building in which mail is received, sorted and distributed

PS.name: power station
PS.description: a facility for generating electric power

PRMN.name: promenade
PRMN.description: a place for public walking, usually along a beach front

PROM.name: promontory(-ies)
PROM.description: a bluff or prominent hill overlooking or projecting into a lowland

PYR.name: pyramid
PYR.description: an ancient massive structure of square ground plan with four triangular faces meeting at a point and used for enclosing tombs

PYRS.name: pyramids
PYRS.description: ancient massive structures of square ground plan with four triangular faces meeting at a point and used for enclosing tombs

MNQR.name: quarry(-ies)
MNQR.description: a surface mine where building stone or gravel and sand, etc. are extracted

QUAY.name: quay
QUAY.description: a structure of solid construction along a shore or bank which provides berthing for ships and which generally provides cargo handling facilities

QCKS.name: quicksand
QCKS.description: an area where loose sand with water moving through it may become unstable when heavy objects are placed at the surface, causing them to sink

RECR.name: racetrack
RECR.description: a track where races are held

OBSR.name: radio observatory
OBSR.description: a facility equipped with an array of antennae for receiving radio waves from space

STNR.name: radio station
STNR.description: a facility for producing and transmitting information by radio waves

RR.name: railroad
RR.description: a permanent twin steel-rail track on which freight and passenger cars move long distances

RJCT.name: railroad junction
RJCT.description: a place where two or more railroad tracks join

RSD.name: railroad siding
RSD.description: a short track parallel to and joining the main track

RSGNL.name: railroad signal
RSGNL.description: a signal at the entrance of a particular section of track governing the movement of trains

RSTN.name: railroad station
RSTN.description: a facility comprising ticket office, platforms, etc. for loading and unloading train passengers and freight

RSTP.name: railroad stop
RSTP.description: a place lacking station facilities where trains stop to pick up and unload passengers and freight

TNLRR.name: railroad tunnel
TNLRR.description: a tunnel through which a railroad passes

RYD.name: railroad yard
RYD.description: a system of tracks used for the making up of trains, and switching and storing freight cars

RNCH.name: ranch(es)
RNCH.description: a large farm specializing in extensive grazing of livestock

RPDS.name: rapids
RPDS.description: a turbulent section of a stream associated with a steep, irregular stream bed

RVN.name: ravine(s)
RVN.description: a small, narrow, deep, steep-sided stream channel, smaller than a gorge

RCH.name: reach
RCH.description: a straight section of a navigable stream or channel between two bends

RF.name: reef(s)
RF.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of consolidated material

PRNJ.name: reformatory
PRNJ.description: a facility for confining, training, and reforming young law offenders

RGN.name: region
RGN.description: an area distinguished by one or more observable physical or cultural characteristics

CTRR.name: religious center
CTRR.description: a facility where more than one religious activity is carried out, e.g., retreat, school, monastery, worship

PPLR.name: religious populated place
PPLR.description: a populated place whose population is largely engaged in religious occupations

RLG.name: religious site
RLG.description: an ancient site of significant religious importance

ITTR.name: research institute
ITTR.description: a facility where research is carried out

RESV.name: reservation
RESV.description: a tract of land set aside for aboriginal, tribal, or native populations

RES.name: reserve
RES.description: a tract of public land reserved for future use or restricted as to use

RSRT.name: resort
RSRT.description: a specialized facility for vacation, health, or participation sports activities

RHSE.name: resthouse
RHSE.description: a structure maintained for the rest and shelter of travelers

RLGR.name: retreat
RLGR.description: a place of temporary seclusion, especially for religious groups

RDGE.name: ridge(s)
RDGE.description: a long narrow elevation with steep sides, and a more or less continuous crest

RD.name: road
RD.description: an open way with improved surface for transportation of animals, people and vehicles

RDB.name: road bend
RDB.description: a conspicuously curved or bent section of a road

RDCUT.name: road cut
RDCUT.description: an excavation cut through a hill or ridge for a road

RDJCT.name: road junction
RDJCT.description: a place where two or more roads join

TNLRD.name: road tunnel
TNLRD.description: a tunnel through which a road passes

RDST.name: roadstead
RDST.description: an open anchorage affording less protection than a harbor

HMDA.name: rock desert
HMDA.description: a relatively sand-free, high bedrock plateau in a hot desert, with or without a gravel veneer

RKFL.name: rockfall
RKFL.description: an irregular mass of fallen rock at the base of a cliff or steep slope

RKRY.name: rookery
RKRY.description: a breeding place of a colony of birds or seals

ESTR.name: rubber plantation
ESTR.description: an estate which specializes in growing and tapping rubber trees

RUIN.name: ruin(s)
RUIN.description: a destroyed or decayed structure which is no longer functional

BDGQ.name: ruined bridge
BDGQ.description: a destroyed or decayed bridge which is no longer functional

DAMQ.name: ruined dam
DAMQ.description: a destroyed or decayed dam which is no longer functional

SBKH.name: sabkha(s)
SBKH.description: a salt flat or salt encrusted plain subject to periodic inundation from flooding or high tides

SDL.name: saddle
SDL.description: a broad, open pass crossing a ridge or between hills or mountains

SALT.name: salt area
SALT.description: a shallow basin or flat where salt accumulates after periodic inundation

MFGN.name: salt evaporation ponds
MFGN.description: diked salt ponds used in the production of solar evaporated salt

LKN.name: salt lake
LKN.description: an inland body of salt water with no outlet

LKSN.name: salt lakes
LKSN.description: inland bodies of salt water with no outlet

MRSHN.name: salt marsh
MRSHN.description: a flat area, subject to periodic salt water inundation, dominated by grassy salt-tolerant plants

MNN.name: salt mine(s)
MNN.description: a mine from which salt is extracted

PNDN.name: salt pond
PNDN.description: a small standing body of salt water often in a marsh or swamp, usually along a seacoast

PNDSN.name: salt ponds
PNDSN.description: small standing bodies of salt water often in a marsh or swamp, usually along a seacoast

SNTR.name: sanatorium
SNTR.description: a facility where victims of physical or mental disorders are treated

SAND.name: sand area
SAND.description: a tract of land covered with sand

ERG.name: sandy desert
ERG.description: an extensive tract of shifting sand and sand dunes

STNS.name: satellite station
STNS.description: a facility for tracking and communicating with orbiting satellites

MLSW.name: sawmill
MLSW.description: a mill where logs or lumber are sawn to specified shapes and sizes

SCH.name: school
SCH.description: building(s) where instruction in one or more branches of knowledge takes place

STNB.name: scientific research base
STNB.description: a scientific facility used as a base from which research is carried out or monitored

SCRB.name: scrubland
SCRB.description: an area of low trees, bushes, and shrubs stunted by some environmental limitation

SEA.name: sea
SEA.description: a large body of salt water more or less confined by continuous land or chains of islands forming a subdivision of an ocean

SCNU.name: seachannel
SCNU.description: a continuously sloping, elongated depression commonly found in fans or plains and customarily bordered by levees on one or two sides

SCSU.name: seachannels
SCSU.description: continuously sloping, elongated depressions commonly found in fans or plains and customarily bordered by levees on one or two sides

SMU.name: seamount
SMU.description: an elevation rising generally more than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summit

SMSU.name: seamounts
SMSU.description: elevations rising generally more than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summit

AIRS.name: seaplane landing area
AIRS.description: a place on a waterbody where floatplanes land and take off

PPLA.name: seat of a first-order administrative division
PPLA.description: seat of a first-order administrative division (PPLC takes precedence over PPLA)

PPLA4.name: seat of a fourth-order administrative division
PPLA4.description: seat of a fourth-order administrative division

PPLA2.name: seat of a second-order administrative division
PPLA2.description: seat of a second-order administrative division

PPLA3.name: seat of a third-order administrative division
PPLA3.description: seat of a third-order administrative division

ADM2.name: second-order administrative division
ADM2.description: a subdivision of a first-order administrative division

SWT.name: sewage treatment plant
SWT.description: facility for the processing of sewage and/or wastewater

SHPF.name: sheepfold
SHPF.description: a fence or wall enclosure for sheep and other small herd animals

SHOL.name: shoal(s)
SHOL.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of unconsolidated material

SHOPC.name: shopping center or mall
SHOPC.description: an urban shopping area featuring a variety of shops surrounding a usually open-air concourse reserved for pedestrian traffic; or a large suburban building or group of buildings containing various shops with associated passageways

SHOR.name: shore
SHOR.description: a narrow zone bordering a waterbody which covers and uncovers at high and low water, respectively

SHRN.name: shrine
SHRN.description: a structure or place memorializing a person or religious concept

SILL.name: sill
SILL.description: the low part of a gap or saddle separating basins

SINK.name: sinkhole
SINK.description: a small crater-shape depression in a karst area

ESTSL.name: sisal plantation
ESTSL.description: an estate that specializes in growing sisal

SLID.name: slide
SLID.description: a mound of earth material, at the base of a slope and the associated scoured area

SLP.name: slope(s)
SLP.description: a surface with a relatively uniform slope angle

SLCE.name: sluice
SLCE.description: a conduit or passage for carrying off surplus water from a waterbody, usually regulated by means of a sluice gate

SNOW.name: snowfield
SNOW.description: an area of permanent snow and ice forming the accumulation area of a glacier

SD.name: sound
SD.description: a long arm of the sea forming a channel between the mainland and an island or islands; or connecting two larger bodies of water

SPA.name: spa
SPA.description: a resort area usually developed around a medicinal spring

CTRS.name: space center
CTRS.description: a facility for launching, tracking, or controlling satellites and space vehicles

SPLY.name: spillway
SPLY.description: a passage or outlet through which surplus water flows over, around or through a dam

SPIT.name: spit
SPIT.description: a narrow, straight or curved continuation of a beach into a waterbody

SPNG.name: spring(s)
SPNG.description: a place where ground water flows naturally out of the ground

SPUR.name: spur(s)
SPUR.description: a subordinate ridge projecting outward from a hill, mountain or other elevation

SQR.name: square
SQR.description: a broad, open, public area near the center of a town or city

STBL.name: stable
STBL.description: a building for the shelter and feeding of farm animals, especially horses

STDM.name: stadium
STDM.description: a structure with an enclosure for athletic games with tiers of seats for spectators

STPS.name: steps
STPS.description: stones or slabs placed for ease in ascending or descending a steep slope

STKR.name: stock route
STKR.description: a route taken by livestock herds

REG.name: stony desert
REG.description: a desert plain characterized by a surface veneer of gravel and stones

RET.name: store
RET.description: a building where goods and/or services are offered for sale

SHSE.name: storehouse
SHSE.description: a building for storing goods, especially provisions

STRT.name: strait
STRT.description: a relatively narrow waterway, usually narrower and less extensive than a sound, connecting two larger bodies of water

STM.name: stream
STM.description: a body of running water moving to a lower level in a channel on land

BNKR.name: stream bank
BNKR.description: a sloping margin of a stream channel which normally confines the stream to its channel on land

STMB.name: stream bend
STMB.description: a conspicuously curved or bent segment of a stream

STMGS.name: stream gauging station
STMGS.description: named place where a measuring station for a watercourse, reservoir or other water body exists

STMM.name: stream mouth(s)
STMM.description: a place where a stream discharges into a lagoon, lake, or the sea

STMS.name: streams
STMS.description: bodies of running water moving to a lower level in a channel on land

DAMSB.name: sub-surface dam
DAMSB.description: a dam put down to bedrock in a sand river

SUBW.name: subway
SUBW.description: a railroad used for mass public transportation primarily in urban areas, all or part of the system may be located below, above, or at ground level

SUBS.name: subway station
SUBS.description: a facility comprising ticket office, platforms, etc. for loading and unloading subway passengers

MLSG.name: sugar mill
MLSG.description: a facility where sugar cane is processed into raw sugar

ESTSG.name: sugar plantation
ESTSG.description: an estate that specializes in growing sugar cane

MFGSG.name: sugar refinery
MFGSG.description: a facility for converting raw sugar into refined sugar

SPNS.name: sulphur spring(s)
SPNS.description: a place where sulphur ground water flows naturally out of the ground

SWMP.name: swamp
SWMP.description: a wetland dominated by tree vegetation

SYG.name: synagogue
SYG.description: a place for Jewish worship and religious instruction

TMTU.name: tablemount (or guyot)
TMTU.description: a seamount having a comparatively smooth, flat top

TMSU.name: tablemounts (or guyots)
TMSU.description: seamounts having a comparatively smooth, flat top

TAL.name: talus slope
TAL.description: a steep concave slope formed by an accumulation of loose rock fragments at the base of a cliff or steep slope

OILT.name: tank farm
OILT.description: a tract of land occupied by large, cylindrical, metal tanks in which oil or liquid petrochemicals are stored

ESTT.name: tea plantation
ESTT.description: an estate which specializes in growing tea bushes

SCHT.name: technical school
SCHT.description: post-secondary school with a specifically technical or vocational curriculum

TMPL.name: temple(s)
TMPL.description: an edifice dedicated to religious worship

AIRT.name: terminal
AIRT.description: airport facilities for the handling of freight and passengers

TRR.name: terrace
TRR.description: a long, narrow alluvial platform bounded by steeper slopes above and below, usually overlooking a waterbody

ADM3.name: third-order administrative division
ADM3.description: a subdivision of a second-order administrative division

CRKT.name: tidal creek(s)
CRKT.description: a meandering channel in a coastal wetland subject to bi-directional tidal currents

FLTT.name: tidal flat(s)
FLTT.description: a large flat area of mud or sand attached to the shore and alternately covered and uncovered by the tide

MNSN.name: tin mine(s)
MNSN.description: a mine where tin ore is extracted

TOWR.name: tower
TOWR.description: a high conspicuous structure, typically much higher than its diameter

RDCR.name: traffic circle
RDCR.description: a road junction formed around a central circle about which traffic moves in one direction only

TRL.name: trail
TRL.description: a path, track, or route used by pedestrians, animals, or off-road vehicles

TRANT.name: transit terminal
TRANT.description: facilities for the handling of vehicular freight and passengers

TREE.name: tree(s)
TREE.description: a conspicuous tree used as a landmark

TRIG.name: triangulation station
TRIG.description: a point on the earth whose position has been determined by triangulation

TRB.name: tribal area
TRB.description: a tract of land used by nomadic or other tribes

TUND.name: tundra
TUND.description: a marshy, treeless, high latitude plain, dominated by mosses, lichens, and low shrub vegetation under permafrost conditions

CNLSB.name: underground irrigation canal(s)
CNLSB.description: a gently inclined underground tunnel bringing water for irrigation from aquifers

LKSB.name: underground lake
LKSB.description: a standing body of water in a cave

APNU.name: undersea apron
APNU.description: a gentle slope, with a generally smooth surface, particularly found around groups of islands and seamounts

ARCU.name: undersea arch
ARCU.description: a low bulge around the southeastern end of the island of Hawaii

ARRU.name: undersea arrugado
ARRU.description: an area of subdued corrugations off Baja California

BNKU.name: undersea bank
BNKU.description: an elevation, typically located on a shelf, over which the depth of water is relatively shallow but sufficient for safe surface navigation

BKSU.name: undersea banks
BKSU.description: elevations, typically located on a shelf, over which the depth of water is relatively shallow but sufficient for safe surface navigation

BSNU.name: undersea basin
BSNU.description: a depression more or less equidimensional in plan and of variable extent

BDLU.name: undersea borderland
BDLU.description: a region adjacent to a continent, normally occupied by or bordering a shelf, that is highly irregular with depths well in excess of those typical of a shelf

CNYU.name: undersea canyon
CNYU.description: a relatively narrow, deep depression with steep sides, the bottom of which generally has a continuous slope

CNSU.name: undersea canyons
CNSU.description: relatively narrow, deep depressions with steep sides, the bottom of which generally has a continuous slope

CDAU.name: undersea cordillera
CDAU.description: an entire mountain system including the subordinate ranges, interior plateaus, and basins

ESCU.name: undersea escarpment (or scarp)
ESCU.description: an elongated and comparatively steep slope separating flat or gently sloping areas

FANU.name: undersea fan
FANU.description: a relatively smooth feature normally sloping away from the lower termination of a canyon or canyon system

FLTU.name: undersea flat
FLTU.description: a small level or nearly level area

FRKU.name: undersea fork
FRKU.description: a branch of a canyon or valley

FRSU.name: undersea forks
FRSU.description: a branch of a canyon or valley

FRZU.name: undersea fracture zone
FRZU.description: an extensive linear zone of irregular topography of the sea floor, characterized by steep-sided or asymmetrical ridges, troughs, or escarpments

FURU.name: undersea furrow
FURU.description: a closed, linear, narrow, shallow depression

GAPU.name: undersea gap
GAPU.description: a narrow break in a ridge or rise

HLLU.name: undersea hill
HLLU.description: an elevation rising generally less than 500 meters

HLSU.name: undersea hills
HLSU.description: elevations rising generally less than 500 meters

HOLU.name: undersea hole
HOLU.description: a small depression of the sea floor

KNLU.name: undersea knoll
KNLU.description: an elevation rising generally more than 500 meters and less than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summit

KNSU.name: undersea knolls
KNSU.description: elevations rising generally more than 500 meters and less than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summits

LDGU.name: undersea ledge
LDGU.description: a rocky projection or outcrop, commonly linear and near shore

LEVU.name: undersea levee
LEVU.description: an embankment bordering a canyon, valley, or seachannel

MDVU.name: undersea median valley
MDVU.description: the axial depression of the mid-oceanic ridge system

MESU.name: undersea mesa
MESU.description: an isolated, extensive, flat-topped elevation on the shelf, with relatively steep sides

MOTU.name: undersea moat
MOTU.description: an annular depression that may not be continuous, located at the base of many seamounts, islands, and other isolated elevations

MTU.name: undersea mountain
MTU.description: a well-delineated subdivision of a large and complex positive feature

MTSU.name: undersea mountains
MTSU.description: well-delineated subdivisions of a large and complex positive feature

PKU.name: undersea peak
PKU.description: a prominent elevation, part of a larger feature, either pointed or of very limited extent across the summit

PKSU.name: undersea peaks
PKSU.description: prominent elevations, part of a larger feature, either pointed or of very limited extent across the summit

PNLU.name: undersea pinnacle
PNLU.description: a high tower or spire-shaped pillar of rock or coral, alone or cresting a summit

PLNU.name: undersea plain
PLNU.description: a flat, gently sloping or nearly level region

PLTU.name: undersea plateau
PLTU.description: a comparatively flat-topped feature of considerable extent, dropping off abruptly on one or more sides

PLFU.name: undersea platform
PLFU.description: a flat or gently sloping underwater surface extending seaward from the shore

PRVU.name: undersea province
PRVU.description: a region identifiable by a group of similar physiographic features whose characteristics are markedly in contrast with surrounding areas

RMPU.name: undersea ramp
RMPU.description: a gentle slope connecting areas of different elevations

RNGU.name: undersea range
RNGU.description: a series of associated ridges or seamounts

RFU.name: undersea reef
RFU.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of consolidated material

RFSU.name: undersea reefs
RFSU.description: surface-navigation hazards composed of consolidated material

RDGU.name: undersea ridge
RDGU.description: a long narrow elevation with steep sides

RDSU.name: undersea ridges
RDSU.description: long narrow elevations with steep sides

RISU.name: undersea rise
RISU.description: a broad elevation that rises gently, and generally smoothly, from the sea floor

SDLU.name: undersea saddle
SDLU.description: a low part, resembling in shape a saddle, in a ridge or between contiguous seamounts

SHFU.name: undersea shelf
SHFU.description: a zone adjacent to a continent (or around an island) that extends from the low water line to a depth at which there is usually a marked increase of slope towards oceanic depths

EDGU.name: undersea shelf edge
EDGU.description: a line along which there is a marked increase of slope at the outer margin of a continental shelf or island shelf

SHVU.name: undersea shelf valley
SHVU.description: a valley on the shelf, generally the shoreward extension of a canyon

SHLU.name: undersea shoal
SHLU.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of unconsolidated material

SHSU.name: undersea shoals
SHSU.description: hazards to surface navigation composed of unconsolidated material

SILU.name: undersea sill
SILU.description: the low part of an underwater gap or saddle separating basins, including a similar feature at the mouth of a fjord

SLPU.name: undersea slope
SLPU.description: the slope seaward from the shelf edge to the beginning of a continental rise or the point where there is a general reduction in slope

SPRU.name: undersea spur
SPRU.description: a subordinate elevation, ridge, or rise projecting outward from a larger feature

TERU.name: undersea terrace
TERU.description: a relatively flat horizontal or gently inclined surface, sometimes long and narrow, which is bounded by a steeper ascending slope on one side and by a steep descending slope on the opposite side

TNGU.name: undersea tongue
TNGU.description: an elongate (tongue-like) extension of a flat sea floor into an adjacent higher feature

TRNU.name: undersea trench
TRNU.description: a long, narrow, characteristically very deep and asymmetrical depression of the sea floor, with relatively steep sides

TRGU.name: undersea trough
TRGU.description: a long depression of the sea floor characteristically flat bottomed and steep sided, and normally shallower than a trench

VALU.name: undersea valley
VALU.description: a relatively shallow, wide depression, the bottom of which usually has a continuous gradient

VLSU.name: undersea valleys
VLSU.description: a relatively shallow, wide depression, the bottom of which usually has a continuous gradient

USGE.name: United States Government Establishment
USGE.description: a facility operated by the United States Government in Panama

UPLD.name: upland
UPLD.description: an extensive interior region of high land with low to moderate surface relief

VAL.name: valley
VAL.description: an elongated depression usually traversed by a stream

VALS.name: valleys
VALS.description: elongated depressions usually traversed by a stream

VETF.name: veterinary facility
VETF.description: a building or camp at which veterinary services are available

VLC.name: volcano
VLC.description: a conical elevation composed of volcanic materials with a crater at the top

WAD.name: wadi
WAD.description: a valley or ravine, bounded by relatively steep banks, which in the rainy season becomes a watercourse; found primarily in North Africa and the Middle East

WADB.name: wadi bend
WADB.description: a conspicuously curved or bent segment of a wadi

WADJ.name: wadi junction
WADJ.description: a place where two or more wadies join

WADM.name: wadi mouth
WADM.description: the lower terminus of a wadi where it widens into an adjoining floodplain, depression, or waterbody

WADS.name: wadies
WADS.description: valleys or ravines, bounded by relatively steep banks, which in the rainy season become watercourses; found primarily in North Africa and the Middle East

WALL.name: wall
WALL.description: a thick masonry structure, usually enclosing a field or building, or forming the side of a structure

MLWTR.name: water mill
MLWTR.description: a mill powered by running water

PMPW.name: water pumping station
PMPW.description: a facility for pumping water from a major well or through a pipeline

RSVT.name: water tank
RSVT.description: a contained pool or tank of water at, below, or above ground level

WTRC.name: watercourse
WTRC.description: a natural, well-defined channel produced by flowing water, or an artificial channel designed to carry flowing water

FLLS.name: waterfall(s)
FLLS.description: a perpendicular or very steep descent of the water of a stream

WTRH.name: waterhole(s)
WTRH.description: a natural hole, hollow, or small depression that contains water, used by man and animals, especially in arid areas

WTRW.name: waterworks
WTRW.description: a facility for supplying potable water through a water source and a system of pumps and filtration beds

WEIR.name: weir(s)
WEIR.description: a small dam in a stream, designed to raise the water level or to divert stream flow through a desired channel

WLL.name: well
WLL.description: a cylindrical hole, pit, or tunnel drilled or dug down to a depth from which water, oil, or gas can be pumped or brought to the surface

WLLS.name: wells
WLLS.description: cylindrical holes, pits, or tunnels drilled or dug down to a depth from which water, oil, or gas can be pumped or brought to the surface

WTLD.name: wetland
WTLD.description: an area subject to inundation, usually characterized by bog, marsh, or swamp vegetation

STNW.name: whaling station
STNW.description: a facility for butchering whales and processing train oil

WHRF.name: wharf(-ves)
WHRF.description: a structure of open rather than solid construction along a shore or a bank which provides berthing for ships and cargo-handling facilities

WHRL.name: whirlpool
WHRL.description: a turbulent, rotating movement of water in a stream

RESW.name: wildlife reserve
RESW.description: a tract of public land reserved for the preservation of wildlife

MLWND.name: windmill
MLWND.description: a mill or water pump powered by wind

WRCK.name: wreck
WRCK.description: the site of the remains of a wrecked vessel

ZOO.name: zoo
ZOO.description: a zoological garden or park where wild animals are kept for exhibition
